Data Analyst,$67K - $101K (Glassdoor est.),McKinney4.0 ★,"New York, NY","JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

The Data Analyst transforms data into insights that drive business value. This position blends hard skills like programming, data modeling and statistics with soft skills like communication, analytical thinking and problem-solving.Through use of data analytics, data visualization and data modeling techniques and technologies, the Data Analyst will identify trends that can help other departments, managers and executives make business decisions to modernize and improve processes in the organization as well as help us tell stories through the results of our many marketing campaigns.

The Data Analyst role is increasingly important as our company moves to capitalize on the volumes of data we collect. The Data Analyst will be responsible for discovering trends across marketing campaigns and identify where improvements can be made to save the client money or increase profits. This will be done by mining complex data using BI software and tools, comparing data to competitors and industry trends and creating visualizations that communicate findings to others in our company or the clients. Job responsibilities include:
Oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse.
Develop policies and procedures for the collection and analysis of data.
Create or discover new data procurement and processing programs.
Work with IT representatives to deploy software and hardware upgrades that make it possible to leverage big data use cases.
Review and validate influencer marketing and social media data as it’s collected.
Monitor analytics and metrics results.
Implement new data analysis methodologies.
Review client files to ensure integrity of data collection and utilization.
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies.
Create and present reports on data trends as requested.
Further establish benchmarks for industry and client programs.
Live into the values of McKinney

Data Analyst,$60K (Employer est.),Wildcat3.5 ★,"New York, NY","Are you someone who loves crunching numbers and deriving insights? Do you have a passion for making a real-world impact through business analysis? Look no further! Join our team at Fedcap - Wildcat and work in our New York office as a Data Analyst.

This is a full-time position with a salary of $60,000 annually. You'll receive generous benefits, including medical, dental, vision, a flexible spending account (FSA), short- and long-term disability, a 403(b) plan, an employee assistance program, a future mom's program, and life insurance. Come be a part of a nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of individuals in our community through business analysis.
OUR MISSION

Wildcat Service Corporation was founded in July 1972 by visionary social entrepreneur, Herb Sturz. We are the first organization in the United States to design and implement a transitional work program for unemployed persons with criminal convictions. Each year Wildcat helps thousands of individuals transition successfully from incarceration to their community so they can find jobs, build careers, and receive the training and guidance needed to achieve economic well-being.

Our services are only as effective as the quality of the people who make up our team. To achieve our mission, we strive to attract and retain talented and committed staff who believe in our cause. This is why we provide competitive compensation, great benefits, and plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth.
YOUR DAY AS A DATA ANALYST

As a Data Analyst at Fedcap - Wildcat, you have a significant impact on the success of our nonprofit's programs and services. Your primary responsibilities involve analyzing our business systems, financial statements, and proposal drafts for review by our Executive Director.

With your impressive skills in Excel, Word, Visio, Salesforce, and Oracle, you're responsible for preparing executive-level presentations that convey complex information in a clear and concise manner. Additionally, you conduct data and business analysis of financial statements, Salesforce pipeline, and operational systems for Wildcat programs and services.

One of your most important responsibilities is to develop and implement a strategy for gathering and reporting meaningful data that reflects the impact of outcomes for our programs and services. You work closely with various departments and stakeholders to ensure that we meet our goals and objectives. We value your contribution to our organization and appreciate the passion and dedication you bring to the table. Thank you for helping us achieve our mission!
WHAT IS REQUIRED TO BE A DATA ANALYST?
Bachelor's degree in related field
column2: Master's preferred

column1: Strong, demonstrable knowledge of financial analytics, budgeting, and reporting
Strong, demonstrable background in finance/accounting
Ability to meet deadlines and work additional hours during peak sessions
Ability to make suggestions to senior management based on analysis
Ability to work independently
Come join our nonprofit and use your business analysis skills to make a positive impact on our community!
HOW TO APPLY

We believe in taking care of our team, both on and off the job. That's why we offer a streamlined 3-minute, mobile-friendly application process - because we know your time is valuable. If you're ready to take your skills to the next level and join a nonprofit that values hard work and good times, complete our application today!

Data Analyst,$60K - $86K (Glassdoor est.),MarginEdge4.9 ★,"Arlington, VA","Are you ready to use your data analysis skills at a company where they will truly have an impact? MarginEdge is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team and make a significant impact on our rapidly growing data-driven business. This is not your typical data analyst role
column2: it's an exciting opportunity to shape the future of our company through data-driven insights and innovation.As a Data Analyst at MarginEdge, you will be crucial in producing and delivering data products that drive critical business decisions. You'll use tools like Preset and Tableau to unlock the potential of our rapidly growing data sets, uncover hidden trends, and transform raw information into actionable insights. Your work will extend beyond the confines of your desk as you collaborate closely with executive leadership and represent your findings to the entire company.

column1: Imagine the satisfaction of knowing that your analysis and visualizations directly influence strategic decisions made by our top leaders. You'll have the opportunity to interact regularly with our executive team, presenting your insights and recommendations and contributing to the overall growth and success of the organization. Your expertise will be valued, and your contributions will have a tangible impact on the company's trajectory.
This role reports to our Vice President of Data Science and will be supported by our larger Data Science and Software Engineering teams.
MarginEdge: &nbsp
column2: Where hospitality meets technology &nbsp

column1: &nbsp

As a team built by former (and current!) restaurant operators, our mission is to bring operators the same energy, attention to detail, and passion that they bring to their guests. Our culture is deeply rooted in service, partially because that’s where so many of our team come from (including everyone on our Business Development team), but also because we believe it is just the right way to run a business. We design our software with profound empathy for the complexity of running a restaurant, and the goal of making the magic just a little easier for operators by taking the complex (read: very annoying) back office tasks off their plate, while empowering them with real-time data.&nbsp
Our founders share a deep history in both owning and operating restaurants and in building successful tech companies. We are venture-backed and serve 4,400+ restaurants across the US and Canada.
We enable restaurants to make magic while knowing we are doing the same for them. &nbsp
Essential Functions / Responsibilities
Use our reporting infrastructure and data warehouse to curate data, build reports, and analyze data for trends and patterns important to support the company's daily operations. &nbsp
Help determine and document the meaning behind our standard vocabulary at the company and ensure there is only one correct answer to any given question. &nbsp
column2: If someone speaks about churn or revenue growth we need to all mean the same thing and have one authoritative place to go for the answer.

column1: Learn everything about the MarginEdge data model. &nbsp
column2: Guide the development of a data model that will support reporting on strategic initiatives for the company. Be an active participant in our code review process for reports. &nbsp

column1: Respond to feedback from others and provide a quality check on reports built by other teams at the company.&nbsp
Collaborate closely with executive leadership, offering strategic insights and recommendations to drive key business decisions.
Qualifications
3+ years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence field
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, management, or business analytics program is preferred
Proficient in SQL
Experience with Tableau, Preset, or other modern business intelligence/reporting platforms
Some capability in R or Python for data analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex data to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for finding patterns and trends within data.
Experience using Salesforce for reporting or analysis would be a bonus

BI Analyst I,-1,Spectrum3.3 ★,"Maryland Heights, MO","Do you have a knack for identifying patterns and trends? Looking for a BI Analyst job that values insights from their data to use information to drive growth and success? If so, you’ll fit right in with Spectrum’s Business Intelligence team!

Spectrum maintains our 32 million customers by offering trailblazing products and services. Our goal is not only to exceed the expectations of our users, but our employees too! In today’s data-driven world, having access to accurate and timely information is crucial to stay competitive and relevant.

Spectrum’s Business Intelligence team plays a vital role in not only working towards the company’s goals but improving our decision making through insights and analysis of data. It’s a high-energy job that allows you to focus on all aspects of Spectrum: business and people! You’d be joining a competent team with quality expectations that values partnership, long-term career growth, and great work-life balance.
BE PART OF THE CONNECTION

As a BI Analyst I, is responsible for supporting and managing a program of business unit-focused initiatives designed to help business partners drive value from information. Contributes to Charter’s success by ensuring business needs and goals are realized through analysis and reporting activities of the Business Intelligence Group. Responsible for supporting the Manager of Business Intelligence to empower Charter business leaders with concise, high-quality information, helping them leverage it to identify and address business opportunities and threats. Provides consultation on the interpretation of data to various business partners throughout the organization. Come join our team and help us drive success through data!
WHAT OUR BUSINESS ANALYSTS ENJOY MOST
Actively and consistently supporting all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.
Communicating data nuances and insights to all levels of the company in a clear and concise manner.
Instilling best practices and support users at all levels of the organization in leveraging BI capabilities for accurate reporting and analysis.

Collaborating closely with business partners to gather detailed business requirements that includes identification and mapping of source system data, and rules for data cleansing, integration and validation.
Creating report mock ups based on requirements and coordinate with technical team to finalize designs.
Understanding data elements in the warehouse at a fine grain to support any form of user needs from research to adhoc querying to managing large information projects.
Interacting with senior management or executive level customers and provide support as needed.
Documenting, presenting and recommending solutions for handling data anomalies and issues.
Maintaining metadata dictionaries and report definitions.
Working with cross functional teams to ensure alignment in business needs, timelines and department standards.
Creating test plans and scenarios and conduct testing to ensure quality and requirements traceability to final deliverable.
WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO SPECTRUM
Required Qualifications
Relevant technical or business work experience - 0.5+ years
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Demonstrated communication skills both written and verbal
Prior experience and passion for leveraging data to drive business impact
Beginner to intermediate statistical knowledge
Beginner to intermediate SQL skills
Ability to speak to large groups with good presentation skills
Ability to perform critical thinking in the area of data analysis with intermediate analytical skills
Proven team and relationship building skills
High attention to detail and quality
Ability to prioritize and organize effectively and manage multiple projects/assignments
Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment
Ability to understand complex business processes, rules and gain business acumen
Required Education
Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Economics, Mathematics, or Business Administration or relevant experience
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Teradata and/or other MPP data warehouse platforms
Experience with Tableau and/or MicroStrategy
Familiarity with BI Data Modeling concepts such as Star/Snowflake Schema, Dimensions and Facts
Working Conditions
Onsite 5 days
SPECTRUM CONNECTS YOU TO MORE
Dynamic Growth: The growth of our industry and evolving technology powers our employees’ careers as they move up or around the company
Supportive Teams: Who you are matters here. And, we aim to foster an inclusive workplace where every person is empowered to bring their best ideas
Learning Culture: With a focus on training and development, employees can have confidence that day one is truly just the beginning of a dynamic career
Total Rewards: See all the ways we invest in you—at work and in life
Apply now, connect a friend to this opportunity or sign up for job alerts!

Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life.
A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances.

Data Analyst,$65K - $72K (Employer est.),Revivn4.0 ★,"Brooklyn, NY","Revivn is a bootstrapped, profitable and rapidly growing company that helps enterprises manage their old technology through our end of life software platform. We take electronic recycling one step further by repurposing hardware that still has remaining life and providing it to people who lack dedicated computer access. Working with companies like Gensler, Thumbtack, and Teach for America we are changing the way companies view old technology with a new model that focuses on repurposing instead of recycling.

As a Data Analyst at Revivn, you will serve as an effective team leader within our Data and Logistics team. This person will have the opportunity to own and succesfuly present and process such data sets to senior managers and stakeholders. They will also be able to establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of operations and business decisions. We are looking for someone willing to adapt as the external environment and organization evolves.
Responsibilities
Proficiency in creating ad-hoc queries.
Demonstrated problem solving experience providing business insights and recommendations from data sets.
Able to analyze complex situations and recommend solutions.
Effective written, verbal, and presentation skills.
Strong client orientation and results-driven.
Able to multi-task and organize workload for effective implementation.
Effective independent judgment and decision-making ability.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to ingest volumes of data, policy, and program points.
Assist in ensuring the integrity, confidentiality, and security of all datasets.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, finance or accounting.
1-2 years working as a Data Analyst.
Computer skills: SQL, Python, BI Tools (Tableau, Hex, Redash), Database Administration).
Run and modify SQL queries to generate list reports from data sources.
Generate data, identify problems within datasets, and resolve data discrepancies.
Create dashboards and interactive custom visualizations using business intelligence tools.
Knowledge of relational database management systems and data warehousing.
Some familiarity with Python, Java, HTML, CSS, VizQl, Tableau, Hex, Redash, Power BI.
Knowledge of ETL pipelines.
Revivn is an equal opportunity employer and strongly encourages applications from people of color, persons with disabilities, women and LGBT applicants.

Data Analyst,$60K - $80K (Employer est.),Effective Spend4.4 ★,"Austin, TX","Effective Spend is looking for a data analyst with experience in digital marketing analytics. The Data Analyst works hand in hand with our PPC and SEO departments to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our client services teams. The Data Analyst helps to clearly quantify performance objectives by maintaining our existing reporting suites, creating new methods of reporting, and automating repetitive tasks.

The Marketing Data Analyst will join our Business Intelligence team – a team that re-imagined our data analytics from the ground up. We started with web tracking and attribution (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager), then moved into reporting automation (SQL and Power BI) and are now driving a shift from descriptive reporting to actionable and insightful dashboarding. Our team is also frontline in detecting anomalies in key performance metrics that alert account managers for intervention. These initiatives directly impact almost every aspect of our company and are critical to driving our continued growth.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual that is excited by new opportunities and the potential to have a large impact. Ideal candidates will be detail-oriented, organized, and professional with the desire to take ownership of multiple projects simultaneously.
Why Effective Spend?

For the last two years in a row, Effective Spend has been named to the Inc 5000 and Austin FAST50 lists of the fastest growing private companies. With fast growth comes real opportunities for quick promotion as you master new areas of digital marketing.

We’re also proud to have been recognized on the Austin Business Journal and BuiltIn Austin lists of the Best Places to Work in Austin. As an integral member of this team, you’ll learn the most, improve the fastest, accomplish more, and have a ton of fun doing it!
Key Responsibilities:

Report Creation – Work with account teams to create custom reports for high value clients that focus on their unique KPIs and reporting needs. Use your skills to create beautiful, insightful, and actionable dashboards for all clients in Microsoft Power BI, Excel, and Google Sheets.

Reporting Automation – Use existing web-based tools to query data from our sources (Adwords, Facebook, Bing, LinkedIn, etc.) and assist in developing new tools for pulling data from other sources (LinkedIn web scraping, CRMs, etc). Automate reports using Power BI, SQL, and formulas & pivot tables in Google Sheets.

Process Management– Define and successfully deploy processes to reduce manual lift and avoid fault points. This includes streamlining our project management process, documenting around account team FAQs, and iterating upon our BI internal documentation.

Marketing Data – Dig into the data presented in platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads and understand what is happening with performance. Understand metrics like impressions, clicks, CTR, conversions, CVR, ROAS, Click-through vs. View-through, attribution windows and modes, path to conversion, A/B testing, etc.
Qualifications & Skill Requirements:
4-year Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, MIS, analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field.
2+ years of experience utilizing tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
2+ years of SQL experience
1+ years of experience in marketing-related analytics.
Experience with PPC, SEM or SEO marketing analytics is a strong plus.
Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas, Pivot Tables, and Macros.
Experience with Microsoft Azure Platform is a plus.
Experience with scripting languages is a plus.
Proficiency in Google Analytics.
Excellent mathematical, problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Experience with HTML/Javascript/CSS is a plus.
Benefits:
Here are some of the ways we support an awesome company culture:
Unlimited PTO
Medical plans with 75% employer-paid coverage
Dental and vision plans with 100% employer-paid coverage
Student loan repayment plans
401k with company matching
100% employer-paid life insurance, long-term disability and short-term disability
Bonuses for employee and client referrals
Healthy snacks, fruit, fresh-ground coffee and cold brew on tap
Daily stipend for lunch delivery
Work-visit program – employees can spend several weeks vacationing in LA and working out of our Los Angeles office

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.
About the team:

You will be working as a key member of the Data Analytics & Strategic Insights team responsible for Worldpay’s Global reporting function. As part of the wider Global Financial Operations group you will be a fundamental component of driving the change in FIS’s Global Merchant solutions offering through the delivery of insights.
The payments industry is going through a period of rapid change and growth. This opportunity would put you at the centre of this with some of the leading cloud-based technologies.
The role is Cincinnati based although the overall analytics team is global with teams in the UK.
What you will be doing:

As a Data Analyst you will be working alongside a diverse team of people working towards the same goal, delivering a single source of truth that the business can utilise in order to make informed decisions about the future of the company. Interpreting data to discover patterns and identify trends, you will create timely, relevant and actionable insights that will be highly impactful. You will be responsible for creating and managing highly intricate data models and data-mining large, complex data sets for opportunities across our portfolio.

You will help us not just deliver data outputs but shape our new cloud-based data warehouse with the next generation of reporting and querying capabilities. All while understanding the long-term goal of self-service based data delivery that our wide stakeholder audience interacts with.

Utilizes a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate exploratory data-mining analyses to reveal insight across the Worldpay portfolio.

Partners with a variety of business teams to gather, document and maintain business requirements that will inform data modelling decisions.
Compiles data from various sources into a single, consumable, data set, including design and implementation of data models.
Identifies and implements data-driven process optimization Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Math, Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or similar
1+ years related experience
Experience in data mining and root cause analysis
Experience in Querying, extracting and transforming large data sets
Experience with relational databases, OLAP Cubes and data warehousing (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, Hadoop, AWS, Snowflake)
Requires strong analytical acumen with the ability to uncover insights and create stories by seamlessly integrating a variety of data sources
Ability to work with large, complex data sets across multiple platforms and design efficient processes to provide accurate and timely information
Able to interpret data, advise and solve problems
Proficiency with sophisticated analytics tools and programming languages (e.g., R, SQL) and visualization tools (Tableau) required
Passionate about data and relish the opportunity to drive insight, analysis, and that will inform data modelling decisions.
An agile and solution-based team player
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
What we offer you:
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
A broad range of professional education and personal development opportunities

Data Analyst,$75K - $80K (Employer est.),Share Local Media4.6 ★,"New York, NY","About us

Share Local Media, or SLM, is a rapidly growing startup reimagining the world of offline marketing for tech and e-commerce companies. We started as e-commerce marketers ourselves, and launched SLM with a goal of turning direct mail into a high performing, scalable channel for a digitally native client set. To do so, we've taken an inputs based-approach to the space, and re-engineered the channel from the ground up to make it easier to test, faster to execute, more measurable, and ultimately, more effective for e-commerce and tech clients of all types.

So what does SLM actually do? We're a full-service direct mail agency, media program operator, and technology platform, serving some of your favorite e-commerce and tech brands (think Casper, Lyft, Grubhub, etc.). We live and breathe direct response marketing, and strive to delight clients with high performing campaigns built around fast, data-driven client service, and premium, unique branding.

What are we like at SLM? We're passionate, humble, and kind. We value data-driven thinking, speed, persistence, creativity, and teamwork. We love helping clients grow and scale through a tactile medium that has long term brand value. And finally, we get excited about transforming an old-school channel into something new through data, product, technology, and a service-driven mentality.
Share our excitement? Great - we'd love to hear from you!
The role

You will be working as part of our data team on a wide range of tasks, which will run from everyday data management and analysis to long term projects to deliver extra value to the business, with plenty of opportunity to contribute and learn. Analyze large data sets and develop custom models/algorithms to uncover trends, patterns, and insights in customer and business data. We frequently work with more data than Excel can handle - you'll select the appropriate tools for the job.

Evaluate current practices, automate common processes, and take initiative to improve business and finance operations. Collaborate and work cross-functionally with data partners to understand and elevate the analytics functions of experience development, business development, consumer marketing strategy, margin optimization, etc.

Maintain and improve data-driven targeting models to improve reach and conversion. Supporting our mail teams with day-to-day tasks such as creating mailing lists and providing performance analysis to clients.
Requirements
Passionate about data, and always excited to find news ways to use it to solve practical business problems.
Bachelor's degree in a STEM or quantitative field.
1-3 years of relevant experience in an analytical role or ability to demonstrate high-quality relevant project work.
Experienced in Excel.
Strong foundation in SQL and at least intermediate level proficiency in a scripting language such as Python or R.
Excellent communication skills and a flair for making complex technical explanations easy for non-technical people to understand.
Skills in creating visualizations for us to explore and to help stake-holders understand the data and takeaways.
Self-starter who is confident in approaching unstructured and open-ended tasks, with great creative problem solving skills.
Comfortable working both independently and as part of a collaborative group, as required by the scope of a project.
Would be great to see:

Exposure to common tools (CRMs, Analytics Tools, Customer Data Platforms etc.) Experience using a BI tool (i.e. Looker and Tableau), setting up dashboards, and an interest in visualizing and exploring data. Using a big data platform for data analysis (Spark, Hadoop etc.) Working with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda etc. as part of your data workflow.
What we offer

Hybrid role based out of our NYC office

Data Analyst,$109K - $133K (Employer est.),Carbon Direct,"San Francisco, CA","Join us on the journey to get to net zero
At Carbon Direct, we dedicate our scientific, software, and business expertise to empower organizations around the world to take climate action.
Our Mission
Enable organizations to reduce, remove, and utilize their emissions with carbon science

We are a purpose-driven carbon management firm dedicated to helping organizations around the world reach their climate goals. We make carbon science accessible and actionable with our end-to-end platform.
Global citizens with global impact

Whether a scientist, developer, or carbon markets expert, we are united by our mission to take climate action now. We are experts in our fields and we act with confidence. Located across 4 countries and 10+ states in the U.S., we offer both remote-friendly work options and dynamic, in-person experiences with offices located in Seattle, WA and Oakland, CA.
Diverse backgrounds bring diverse perspectives

We recognize that teams with diverse backgrounds and different experiences are powerful. Bringing together a variety of perspectives only enhances how we can effectively address the climate crisis. Together, we are creating an environment where everyone is celebrated and anyone can succeed.
Overview

We are seeking an analyst to primarily help calculate carbon footprints for clients, in line with existing standards and protocols. Ideally, the analyst will identify opportunities to improve existing data models that can be incorporated into our core product offering. We want somebody who is adept at leveraging machine learning to identify reduction opportunities, compare outcomes against industry averages, and guide product development. While the role will be initially focused on carbon measurement, we are seeking a motivated analyst who wants to expand into other parts of the business, and is also able to manage bespoke client data problems. The role will require close collaboration with multiple teams within Carbon Direct (especially science, product, technology, and customer success).
Responsibilities
Calculate and analyze carbon footprints.
Work with the product team on automation
Monitor and stay updated on carbon measurement standards and protocols.
Compare carbon footprints against industry averages to identify areas for improvement.
Manage and solve unique data-related issues for our clients.
Visualize data findings using tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Data Studio, presenting complex data in a way that is easy to understand.
Use data to help drive decisions and strategies for reducing carbon footprints.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data analysis, machine learning, and carbon measurement.
Qualifications

Data Engineer/Analyst,-1,DeleteMe,United States,"About DeleteMe, The Online Privacy Company
DeleteMe is an online privacy company that makes easy-to-use tools for consumers and businesses to control what personal information companies, third parties, and other people see about them online.

DeleteMe is a rapidly growing SaaS privacy business operating globally and remotely – we are the emerging leader based on # customers and revenues in a fast-growing nascent category of consumer and enterprise security Privacy Services. What we do - our mission - matters because we are restoring a sense of privacy, fairness, and control of personal data in the possession of others. Easier, simpler, control underpinned by a suite of new data privacy laws being passed worldwide will play a part in greater personal security, and freedom, and in stronger democracies in an era where data collection is at unprecedented levels. This is what our work and brand stand for and we are building a large, sustainable, for-profit business to catalyze this. We have strong B2C and B2B businesses with respective product offerings informed by feedback from an active customer base growing between 30% and 200% year/year. DeleteMe is well-capitalized: profitable for the last three years with an 8-figure balance sheet and large-scale venture firms as investors.
DeleteMe is led by a passionate team, backed by premier investment firms, and supercharged by a strong mission to empower consumers with privacy.
Job Summary

The Data Engineer/Analyst will help us manage and use data to make good decisions about what we build, how we help our customers, and how we grow our company. The ideal candidate combines the ability to operate and evolve the data pipelines as well as perform data analysis tasks and will work closely with our engineering and product teams to improve the way we collect structure, and store data. Work with our management, marketing, sales, and service teams to understand what they need and drive the requirement process peaking their domain language to get them the data they need the way they want to empower them to make good decisions.

We are building our data practice from the ground up so you will have the opportunity to work on a new modern data engineering tech stack. We use Snowflake as our Data Warehouse and Fivetran as our ETL tool. We use DBT to extract, transform, and load our data and enable CI/CD capabilities. We are big Open Source users and use Apache Superset as our reporting tool. Reverse ETL is performed using Hightouch and components of Rudderstack. Our tech platform includes AWS, RDS, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes. Python is planned to become the to-go tech for data analysis and modeling.
We are just getting started, so you will be a key driver in building our data engineering practice from the ground up.
Responsibilities
Maintain and evolve our data pipeline infrastructure
column2: help identify the new/best tools and tech for the job.

column1: Improve our data collection and storage practices to enhance the value of our internal dataBuild pipelines and data flows.
Ensure our data is available where it is needed when it is needed.
Interview business users and document data reporting and analysis requirements, develop ELT, data models, and dashboards.

Design and implement a strategy and systems for data analysis, reporting, querying, and visualization to enable internal and external partners to explore our data, answer their questions, and make good decisions.
Requirements

4+ years of proven working experience in data engineering/warehousing, data analysis, data modeling, and reporting for a business department of a SaaS company, who wants to be a big part of helping a team achieve big things, who believes in privacy as a mission, and who can both operate independently and help a team be more than the sum of its parts.
These are some of the specific characteristics we are looking for
Strong technical and people skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with data engineering/data warehousing/analytics engineering.
Experience with building SQL-based data pipelines and data models.
Experience with database design and implementation.
Experience with gathering and documenting reporting requirements.
Experience with data reporting and visualization tools.
Experience with appropriate programming languages and technologies.
Preferred experience with existing toolsets:
Familiarity with Snowflake is a prerequisite/requirement for this position.
Any SQL DB as a primary data source
column2: NoSQL is a plus.

column1: Fivetran, Snowflake, DBT, Hightouch.
Apache Superset, Tableau, or a similar interactive data visualization software.
Basic knowledge of Python, R, or another standard data analysis language/framework.
BS in Computer Science / STEM / Economics.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment, where change is constant, and flexibility is key.
What We Offer

Comprehensive health benefits flexible schedule. 100% work from home 401k matching. Paid time off. 12 company paid holidays. Gym membership reimbursement. Spatial Data Analyst,$60K - $90K (Glassdoor est.),ReServe,"New York, NY","Reserve is seeking a skilled and motivated full-time Spatial Data Analyst to join our analytics team in the New York, NY area. As a Spatial Data Analyst, you are responsible for analyzing and interpreting spatial data, creating visualizations and maps, and providing insights to support decision-making processes.

We are dedicated to improving the lives of individuals with disabilities and other barriers to employment. As a Spatial Data Analyst, you have the opportunity to apply your skills and expertise to support our mission and make a difference in the lives of our clients. If you are a talented and driven professional with a passion for spatial data analytics, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer a competitive salary, as well as opportunities for professional development and growth for our Spatial Data Analysts within our human services nonprofit.
ABOUT ReServe

Founded in 2005, ReServe is a nonprofit organization with a vision of utilizing the talents of older adults to help solve societal challenges. In 2013, we joined The Fedcap Group, a leading nonprofit organization dedicated to creating opportunities for people with barriers to economic well-being. Through this partnership, we continue to provide opportunities for older adults to remain engaged in the workforce and contribute to society's greater good.

With fifteen years of experience, we have a proven track record of leveraging the talents of our workforce to bring about positive change in communities. Our ""ReServists"" bring a wealth of skills and problem-solving experience to organizations in the community. We strive to show our appreciation for our incredible team members through competitive compensation, a supportive work environment, and plenty of opportunities for growth. Join us today and become a part of our mission!
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A SPATIAL DATA ANALYST

As a Spatial Data Analyst with our human services nonprofit, your career is fast-paced and fulfilling. Your day starts by developing relationships with community members, elected officials, and community-based organizations that share the passion to improve health equity in the New York City area. You work with your analytics team to assess equity in messaging and events through the effectiveness of various media posts and collateral. Using your computer and mathematical skills, you develop applications and programs that gather geospatial data, and you work on developing Geographic Information Systems (GIS) that can be used for analysis and reports of key health equity needs and services rendered. You determine the cultural, linguistic, health equity, and community needs of the project, and then create programs or systems that ensure program data integrity.

Using your eye for detail, you create algorithms for processing spatial data for effective reporting and discovery of opportunities to address gaps in health equity or the influential variables thereof. You train other staff, and through the community, to analyze GIS systems, reports, and data that may be leveraged to address local health disparities. Your analytics skills come into play while reviewing broad data sets and providing actionable insights to better inform business decisions. You work with the communications lead to analyze available deliverables data with an interest in decreasing barriers and maximizing community uptake of services and resources provided by ReServe.

As a member of cross-functional squads that include finance, field reporting, human resources, and business customers, you gather requirements from different business units, translate them to engineering problems, and explain the results to non-technical teammates. You develop and maintain inventory systems, metric reports, and data visualizations, collaborating closely with staff and business stakeholders to guarantee proper implementation of tracking and reporting. In this geospatial role, you maintain and re-engineer existing ETLs to increase data accuracy, data stability, and pipeline performance. You go home knowing that you have made a real difference in improving health equity in your community! You love what you do and you enjoy utilizing your analytics skills in this Spatial Data Analyst position.
QUALIFICATIONS FOR A SPATIAL DATA ANALYST
Bachelor's degree in geography, computer science, or equivalent
2+years of data analyst experience
Proficient in Excel, GIS software, and like systems
Ability to collaborate between business professionals, city agencies, as well as internally

We need the person in the geospatial position to have strong analytics skills and fantastic problem-solving abilities. This analyst role needs to have exceptional communication skills and a drive to build strong business relationships. Do you have a keen eye and excellent organizational skills? Are you flexible and feel you can adapt as program needs change? Can you exercise great time management skills and maintain productivity expectations? If yes, you might just be perfect for this Spatial Data Analyst position with our human services nonprofit!
WORK SCHEDULE FOR A SPATIAL DATA ANALYST

This analytics position with our human services nonprofit works regular business hours. Assignments in this geospatial role may include operation in a field environment through all 5 boroughs of New York City.
ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR ANALYTICS TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this geospatial analyst opportunity, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting with you about this analytics role with our human services nonprofit!

Collaborating with third-party research providers, you'll help paint a clear picture of business opportunities for our teammates and clients. Data Strategy at McKinney is all about making informed decisions through insightful analysis.
PLEASE NOTE
In order to be considered for this position please prepare a cover letter for your submission. Submissions without cover letters will not be considered until other applicants are reviewed.
Responsibilities
This is what the job entails, versus what the job requires, which is listed below under Competencies and Expectations.
Managing Primary Research Efforts:
Development, fielding and analysis of online surveys
Incorporate statistical methodologies like correspondence mapping, regression analysis, cluster analysis, etc. into client research efforts
Management of 3rd party vendor relationships (e.g., panel providers, market research firms, etc.)
Staying up to date on market research methodologies
Utilizing secondary data resources:
Build, mine and explicate audiences within SimmonsMRI, Global Web Index, etc.
Leverage data from realtime brand tracking with YouGov, ComScore, etc.
Conducting social listening on platforms such as Netbase, Quid, BrandWatch, etc.
Assist in the development of tools and processes to generate insights from new data sources as they arise
Leveraging 3rd party research
Digesting and analyzing third party research reports from Mintel, WARC, Pew, etc.
Staying on top of client-specific industry trends
Competencies and Expectations
Now that you know what the role entails, here’s what you need to be able to do to thrive in it.
Must haves:
A background market research or a consumer insights role in an advertising agency or marketing department
Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets: You’ll need to know pivot tables, VLookups and how to generate descriptive statistics within either.
Experience with online survey software such as Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, etc.
Experience with at least one of the following: SPSS, SAS, R, Matlab or other statistical software applications
Data visualization: generation of charts and graphs within Excel/PowerPoint or Google Sheets. Tableau is a plus but not required.
A deep curiosity for understanding why consumers make decisions about brands and how culture influences them that process
A desire to understand the multiple ways to deliver on research objectives
An ability to present findings visually, verbally, and written. Telepathic communication is a plus but not required.
An ability to present market research findings to non-subject matter experts.
Experience in at least one of the following areas is required:
Social listening tools like Netbase, Meltwater, BrandWatch
Syndicated research services like SimmonsMRI or Global Web Index
Experience with research partners such as Kantar, MillwardBrown, IPSOS, MediaScience, LRW, etc
Experience
3-5 years of related experience within one of the following: Consumer or Brand Insights role at an advertising agency, market research firm, or marketing department

With Annual Fund director, build targeted audience lists for Direct Marketing solicits. Pull lists, import data, set up codes in RE for gift tracking, work with Donor Services to ensure accurate coding, and share results to teams on solicit performance quarterly or as requested.

Review and update portfolios and work with Global Connectors to manage coding so they can track and report on their own gift solicitations and stewardship activities.
Support pipeline modeling and forecasting for new prospect management.

Qualifications
Open heart and open mind. You start by listening. You believe another person’s truth and it changes you. It unlocks your way of thinking in that moment, it opens your world.
Curiosity. You are always learning. You ask why and why again. You know that change (big and small) is constant, which means your curiosity to learn is matched with adaptability to evolve.

Trust. You believe that people do their best, are disciplined, and care about this as much as you do. You take responsibility for your part and know how to step back and give others the space to shine.

Borderless Team of 2,500 staff worldwide that sees possibility, celebrates moments of abundance, shares new ideas, and strives to do a better thing every day.

Bright Power has been a transformative player in clean energy and sustainable buildings since 2004. We believe a meaningful difference in climate change will only be realized if it is easy for building owners to make their buildings better.

Our approach is simple: we find energy and water problems in buildings, we fix them, and we follow up to make sure the solutions worked. Behind the scenes, our unique combination of software, analytics, engineering, and contracting makes it all happen. If you have a can-do problem-solving attitude and are excited to join a company of the brightest minds working on energy and water in buildings, then apply to join our team!
Join Us

Bright Power is comprised of a team of diverse, talented, and hard-working individuals committed to growing this industry and making a positive impact on the environment. We are passionate about reducing energy and water usage by implementing energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies. Our goal is to improve the health, comfort, and value of our client’s buildings, while cultivating a sustainable future. We believe deeply in doing well by doing good and come to work every day seeking to change the world.
The Role

Bright Power is seeking a Data Analyst to join Bright Power’s Data Solutions Team. This role reports to the Data Services Manager and operates at the intersection between the energy analysts, the software development team, product managers and external data providers. The Data Analyst creates, monitors, and improves processes and tools to increase overall data quality, lower data costs, and/or reduce friction throughout the data procurement pipeline. The Data Analyst also regulates and ensures quality data flow into our core systems, allowing Bright Power to be confident in the data it provides to its clients. This involves tracking the status of active accounts, as well as diagnosing and fixing issues related to data flow and quality.
You will thrive in this role if you are a fast learner, problem-solver, and an excellent communicator.

Create and maintain clear documentation for processes
Develop data visualization dashboards
Leverage software tools and python scripts to increase automation of data flows to reduce manual work
Contribute to growth and operational efficiency of the company by making suggestions for improvements
Showcase the data team’s impact and value in alignment with department and company goals

Experience with MySQL

Attention to detail and ability to iterate and execute incremental tasks

Strong work ethic and able to work independently
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Interest in learning about data analysis, utility data, and how real estate companies understand and manage energy and water across diverse portfolios
Passion for sustainability and climate change mitigation

The Data Analyst Apprenticeship is an entry-level position within Merck geared toward building upon the foundations of a career as a Data Analyst. As an Apprentice, you will complete the Open Classrooms Data Analyst Registered Apprenticeship training program while simultaneously working for Merck. You will earn a stipend during the training program. The program rhythm consists of one day of online technical training, working one-on-one with a mentor, and four days of on-the-job training per week. The 15-month competency-based training includes a 3-month intensive Bootcamp to build core skills and introduce tools and technology that will be used through the apprenticeship training program and 12 months of technical training.
Futureproof your career with OpenClassrooms

OpenClassrooms’ mission is to make education accessible to everyone. Through this apprenticeship opportunity with Merck, you can learn a new job while simultaneously receiving a unique 100% online training experience that combines 20% theory and 80% real-life projects, ensuring you are fully prepared for the job ahead. Write computer programming code.
Design software applications.

OpenClassrooms Course Certificate: Improve your Data Literacy

Medical Insurance

Data Associate,$53K - $76K (Glassdoor est.),Alight4.0 ★,"New York, NY","Data Associate
July 2023 | U.S. Remote, with a preference for NYC, Minneapolis, or DC hub | Part Time/Temporary Contract | 20-25 hrs/week
Hello Hello! So you’re interested in joining us? Welcome, we’re happy you’re here.
When you join Alight, you’ll find…

A team with deep experience in co-designing solutions that create new value around the world. We know we need to always be better, and we believe in the power and abundance of everyday people, everywhere, to change the world with us.
A culture of radical accountability to our customers – as we help build a meaningful life for and with the displaced, we ask them what they want and then deliver on it.
An organization that refuses to settle for anything less than delivering human-worthy services.
If you are looking to be part of a living, breathing, ever-changing organization full of disrupters and doers, then read on!
We are proud to work on borderless teams. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds and specifically encourage members of refugee, immigrant, or other displaced communities to join us.
The Team

You’re on a team ambitiously advancing the work of Alight by actively engaging donors, supporters, and partners in a way that is meaningful to them and promotes Alight’s work worldwide. The Marketing and Engagement Team is comprised of the following departments: Annual Fund, Global Connectors (Major Gifts), Partnerships & Government Affairs, Donor Services, Marketing & Communications, and Operations. This role will collaborate closely with all teams while sitting within a new operations team.
We strive to represent the diverse communities we serve. Applicants who contribute to this diversity and those who bring lived experience with displacement are strongly encouraged to apply.
The Role

The Data Associate supports the Marketing and Engagement team in fulfilling its purpose to raise Alight’s visibility, increase private giving, build strategic partnerships, and engage our donors. Reporting to the Engagement Operations Manager and following guidance from team directors, this position supports the Annual Fund, Global Connectors, and Partnerships teams to track and report on their fundraising goals. This role will collaborate with Donor Services and the Marketing & Engagement Specialist to align data across teams.
Raiser’s Edge Data Management – 50%

Confirm data exists and is accurate across all platforms. Download and import constituent records from a variety of platforms, including Airtable, Active Campaign, and Classy. Import data from third parties and update dynamic content monthly or as needed.
Manage input and extraction of data in the database. Run reports regularly or upon request.
Using chart of activities, review and update data as needed to track and measure returns on investment.
Globally and manually update Raiser’s Edge (RE) records to reflect new systems, including constituents, gifts, actions, and code tables.
Extract data to track annual fundraising targets and run comparative reports on donor performance.
Support the development of progress dashboards and data visualizations.
Annual Fund Activities – 25%

With Annual Fund director, build targeted audience lists for Direct Marketing solicits. Pull lists, import data, set up codes in RE for gift tracking, work with Donor Services to ensure accurate coding, and share results to teams on solicit performance quarterly or as requested.
Globally update donor communication preferences in response to targeted emails, calls, or texts.
Portfolios & Relationship Management Support – 25%
Review and update portfolios and work with Global Connectors to manage coding so they can track and report on their own gift solicitations and stewardship activities.
Support pipeline modeling and forecasting for new prospect management.
Run insight reports on donor demographics and wealth analytics for marketing segmentation or cultivation around affinity groups.
As with all of our teammates, we anticipate an agile mindset and workstyle to take on other projects as assigned.

Work Location: This position is remote, with a preference for proximity to our NYC, DC, or Minneapolis hubs for occasional in-person collaboration. These hubs also offer access to collaborative workspaces for those interested in a hybrid work model.
Work Hours: This position is 20-25 hours per week (25 max), with flexibility between 9am-6pm Eastern. A core-hours model will be discussed during the interview process.
Position Duration: This position is approved through March 2024, with a start date of August or September.
Qualifications
Open heart and open mind. You start by listening. You believe another person’s truth and it changes you. It unlocks your way of thinking in that moment, it opens your world.
Curiosity. You are always learning. You ask why and why again. You know that change (big and small) is constant, which means your curiosity to learn is matched with adaptability to evolve.

Trust. You believe that people do their best, are disciplined, and care about this as much as you do. You take responsibility for your part and know how to step back and give others the space to shine.
We’re also looking for the following technical competencies:
Experience working in Raiser’s Edge or other relevant fundraising CRM software
Comfort and track record working in and across multiple complex data systems
Flexibility & ease with ambiguity: we respond to opportunity as it arises
Excellent organizational skills: ability to work productively in a fast-paced environment and ability handle multiple tasks simultaneously
Gap detection: use and simplify data systems to deliver results to many stakeholders
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft systems, particularly Excel

These are the things we’re aiming to find. However, we’re open to being surprised. If you embody the spirit of Alight, care deeply about the cause, and if you bring something else that’s special, then please reach out.
Benefits
Borderless Team of 2,500 staff worldwide that sees possibility, celebrates moments of abundance, shares new ideas, and strives to do a better thing every day.
Family Friendly – We know that you are a whole person with a life and a family. We honor this. In return, we expect that you will take ownership of your work and follow-through on your commitments
column2: sometimes that means flexing your schedule and we’re good with that.

The Data Analyst Role for Vetcove’s Brand Partnerships team plays a pivotal part in leveraging large data sets to deliver powerful competitive intelligence and campaign insights to our largest partners. Vetcove’s Data Analysts collaborate closely with our Partner Success Managers and Account Managers to foster and grow our client partner relationships.

Determine upselling and cross-selling opportunities to drive incremental sales
Coordinate with internal parties to produce regular campaign reporting to our partners that convey optimal performance

Ability to build and execute an effective approach to a variety of unstructured problems
Ability to communicate complex quantitative results to less data-savvy stakeholders, both internally and externally
Experience Python (especially knowledge of data centric packages like pandas)
Expertise in Excel, stat packages like R or SAS, Tableau
An analytical approach and problem solving abilities
Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills

Attention all job seekers! We want to ensure that you’re well-informed about a serious matter affecting the job market. It has come to our attention that scammers are operating in the industry, impersonating employees and attempting to deceive savvy applicants like you. Here’s what you need to know:

Our job listings are exclusively available on official sites (our careers page, LinkedIn, BuiltIn, and Indeed). Be cautious of other sources claiming to represent us or any organization that you’re interested in. Stay on the lookout!

Authentic communications from our company will only come through verified email addresses and phone numbers. If you receive unexpected messages or calls, exercise caution and verify their authenticity. Don’t let scammers catch you off guard!

It's essential to independently verify the legitimacy of any job postings you come across. Visit our official careers page to confirm the validity of any openings. Stay proactive and protect yourself!

Remember that during the application process, we will never request sensitive personal or financial information from you. Be wary of anyone asking for such information. Keep your personal data secure!

If you suspect any fraudulent activity or encounter suspicious individuals, please report it immediately to our recruiting department. By working together, we can combat these scams and keep the job market safer for everyone.
We understand the importance of your job search and want to ensure your experience is positive and secure. Always exercise caution and stay scam-smart!

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Data Analyst Apprenticeship at Merck & Co., Inc.,$30.00 Per Hour (Employer est.),OpenClassrooms3.8 ★,"Kenilworth, NJ","Apprenticeship Overview
_Position Summary

The Data Analyst Apprenticeship is an entry-level position within Merck geared toward building upon the foundations of a career as a Data Analyst. As an Apprentice, you will complete the Open Classrooms Data Analyst Registered Apprenticeship training program while simultaneously working for Merck. You will earn a stipend during the training program. The program rhythm consists of one day of online technical training, working one-on-one with a mentor, and four days of on-the-job training per week. The 15-month competency-based training includes a 3-month intensive Bootcamp to build core skills and introduce tools and technology that will be used through the apprenticeship training program and 12 months of technical training.
Futureproof your career with OpenClassrooms

OpenClassrooms’ mission is to make education accessible to everyone. Through this apprenticeship opportunity with Merck, you can learn a new job while simultaneously receiving a unique 100% online training experience that combines 20% theory and 80% real-life projects, ensuring you are fully prepared for the job ahead. Joining OpenClassrooms means becoming part of a global community of over 12,000 active and motivated learners spread across 72 countries.
Apprentice Responsibilities:
The work-study program participant will have the following responsibilities as part of the technical and work-study program:
Analyze data to identify trends or relationships among variables.
Determine appropriate methods for data analysis.
Evaluate technical data to determine the effect on designs or plans.
Evaluate data quality.
Prepare data for analysis.
Present research results to others.
Prepare analytical reports.
Prepare graphics or other visual representations of information.
Design research studies to obtain scientific information.
Apply mathematical principles or statistical approaches to solve problems in scientific or applied fields.
Evaluate project designs to determine adequacy or feasibility.
Supervise information technology personnel.
Update knowledge about emerging industry or technology trends.
Implement security measures for computer or information systems.
Install computer software.
Write computer programming code.
Design software applications.
Qualifications:
For eligibility, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
Able to work (100%remote or onsite/hybrid) within Merck’s Upper Gwynedd location.
Note: First three months will be remote training, then shift to the worksite.
Be over 18 years of age. Be a U.S. citizen and have the right to work in the U.S.
Availability to train for 15 months: 3 months Bootcamp(remote) + 12 months apprenticeship program (100%remote or onsite/hybrid).
Language: Have a strong verbal and written level of English (for non-native speakers, a CEFR level of B2, an IELTS band score of 6.5, or a TOEFL score of 80 is recommended).
Education- Client specific: Have a high school diploma, vocational certificate, or equivalent. With the highest qualification, an associate's degree or some college level.
Technical prerequisites to enroll in the Bootcamp:
OpenClassrooms Course Certificate: Improve your Data Literacy
APPLICATION PROCESS
Upon applying, you will first complete OpenClassrooms’ admissions process to confirm your eligibility to the program. We will guide you through the next steps with Merck.
Benefits:
Medical Insurance
Holiday and Sick days
A PC, webcam, and headset will be provided to you during the contract to support program requirements.
Why should you join this program?
Earn and Learn - earn a salary with benefits while training in a professional occupation.
Earn a credential that can be used to further your career
Weekly 1:1 mentorship throughout training with an industry professional

Bright Power has been a transformative player in clean energy and sustainable buildings since 2004. We believe a meaningful difference in climate change will only be realized if it is easy for building owners to make their buildings better.

Our approach is simple: we find energy and water problems in buildings, we fix them, and we follow up to make sure the solutions worked. Behind the scenes, our unique combination of software, analytics, engineering, and contracting makes it all happen. If you have a can-do problem-solving attitude and are excited to join a company of the brightest minds working on energy and water in buildings, then apply to join our team!
Join Us

Bright Power is comprised of a team of diverse, talented, and hard-working individuals committed to growing this industry and making a positive impact on the environment. We are passionate about reducing energy and water usage by implementing energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies. Our goal is to improve the health, comfort, and value of our client’s buildings, while cultivating a sustainable future. We believe deeply in doing well by doing good and come to work every day seeking to change the world.
The Role

Bright Power is seeking a Data Analyst to join Bright Power’s Data Solutions Team. This role reports to the Data Services Manager and operates at the intersection between the energy analysts, the software development team, product managers and external data providers. The Data Analyst creates, monitors, and improves processes and tools to increase overall data quality, lower data costs, and/or reduce friction throughout the data procurement pipeline. The Data Analyst also regulates and ensures quality data flow into our core systems, allowing Bright Power to be confident in the data it provides to its clients. This involves tracking the status of active accounts, as well as diagnosing and fixing issues related to data flow and quality.
You will thrive in this role if you are a fast learner, problem-solver, and an excellent communicator.

Track metrics and generate reports
Create and maintain clear documentation for processes
Develop data visualization dashboards
Leverage software tools and python scripts to increase automation of data flows to reduce manual work
Contribute to growth and operational efficiency of the company by making suggestions for improvements
Showcase the data team’s impact and value in alignment with department and company goals

Expertise with Excel
Experience with MySQL
Familiarity with JIRA, Tableau, Python and/or Salesforce strongly preferred
Familiarity with data visualization
Ability to manage multiple responsibilities and tight deadlines
Attention to detail and ability to iterate and execute incremental tasks
Critical thinking, logic-based reasoning, and problems solving abilities
Strong work ethic and able to work independently
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Interest in learning about data analysis, utility data, and how real estate companies understand and manage energy and water across diverse portfolios
Passion for sustainability and climate change mitigation

Management Analyst II,-1,State of Delaware2.6 ★,"New Castle, DE","Introduction
Make a Difference with DHSS

Our mission at the Department of Health and Social Services (DHSS) is to improve the quality of life of Delaware citizens by promoting health and well-being, fostering self-sufficiency, and protecting vulnerable populations. We prioritize personal and family independence by assisting individuals and families in a variety of life areas.

We offer numerous career opportunities and are dedicated to attracting and retaining highly talented individuals who are ready to make a difference in their community today. DHSS is a great place to kick-start your profession.
For more information, please visit https://dhss.delaware.gov/dhss/ today!
Summary Statement

The Management Analyst II's primary responsibility is performing data collection and statistical analysis for studies for DSSC. Coordinating and conducting studies to provide technical assistance and recommendations to division components.
Essential Functions

Essential functions are fundamental, core functions common to all positions in the class series and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties for any one position in the class. Since class specifications are descriptive and not restrictive, incumbents can complete job duties of similar kind not specifically listed here.

Interviews agency staff, observes work processes and gathers data relating to operational and managerial practices and procedures for use in evaluating services provided and/or determining compliance to goals and objectives.
Reviews, performs statistical analysis and interpretation of collected data relating to policies, procedures, organization, managerial and operational practices
column2: Defines and may make recommendations for correcting problems.

column1: Analyzes data gathered and develops solutions or alternative methods of proceeding.
Analyzes and evaluates the effectiveness of operations in meeting established goals and objectives.
Provides technical assistance in understanding and developing management objectives and controls for resolution of issues and concerns.
Studies pertinent background material such as legislation, administrative orders and regulations.
Makes recommendations for and assists in the implementation of new techniques or procedures to improve methods of operations, strengthen controls, and effectively utilize resources.
Documents findings of studies and prepares recommendations for implementation of new systems, procedures, or organizational changes.

May supervise administrative support and/or paraprofessional staff. Supervision is exercised over at least two or more merit full time positions per the Merit Rules. The elements of supervision include planning, assigning, reviewing, evaluating, coaching, training, recommending hire/fire and discipline.
Job Requirements
JOB REQUIREMENTS for Management Analyst II
Applicants must have education, training and/or experience demonstrating competence in each of the following areas:

Six months experience in conducting studies which includes evaluating operations, programs, services, policies and procedures to determine efficiency, effectiveness, whether goals and objectives are met and compliance with laws, rules, regulations, policies and procedures.
Six months experience in descriptive statistics such as the mean, median, mode or standard deviation.
Six months experience in interpreting laws, rules, regulations, standards, policies, and procedures.
Six months experience in narrative report writing.
Knowledge of designing studies which includes determining study goals and objectives, information needed, data sources, sampling and collection methods.
Knowledge of making recommendations for continuation or changes to operations, programs, services, policies or procedures based on findings.
Knowledge of inferential statistics such as correlation, t-tests, f-tests or analysis of variance.
Additional Posting Information
This is a Casual/Seasonal position which is a non-pension eligible position without healthcare and/or other benefits.
Conditions of Hire

Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. The State of Delaware participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. For more information refer to our Job Seeker Resources.
DHSS does not provide employment-based sponsorship.
Selection Process

The application and supplemental questionnaire are evaluated based upon a rating of your education, training and experience as they relate to the job requirements of the position. It is essential that you provide complete and accurate information on your application and the supplemental questionnaire to include dates of employment, job title and job duties. For education and training, list name of educational provider, training course titles and summary of course content. Narrative information supplied in response to the questions must be supported by the information supplied on the application including your employment, education and training history as it relates to the job requirements.

Once you have submitted your application on-line, all future correspondence related to your application will be sent via email. Please keep your contact information current. You may also view all correspondence sent to you by the State of Delaware in the “My Applications” tab at StateJobs.Delaware.gov.
Accommodations

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an auxiliary aid or service please call (302) 739-5458. TDD users should call the Delaware Relay Service Number 1-800-232-5460 for assistance.

The State of Delaware is an Equal Opportunity employer and values a diverse workforce. We strongly encourage and seek out a workforce representative of Delaware including race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

As a Consumer Insights Analyst at McKinney, your role is to uncover meaningful connections between business, consumers, and culture. You'll gather and analyze data from various sources, including online surveys, social media, and market research databases. Collaborating with third-party research providers, you'll help paint a clear picture of business opportunities for our teammates and clients. Data Strategy at McKinney is all about making informed decisions through insightful analysis.
PLEASE NOTE
In order to be considered for this position please prepare a cover letter for your submission. Submissions without cover letters will not be considered until other applicants are reviewed.
Responsibilities
This is what the job entails, versus what the job requires, which is listed below under Competencies and Expectations.
Managing Primary Research Efforts:
Development, fielding and analysis of online surveys
Incorporate statistical methodologies like correspondence mapping, regression analysis, cluster analysis, etc. into client research efforts
Management of 3rd party vendor relationships (e.g., panel providers, market research firms, etc.)
Staying up to date on market research methodologies
Utilizing secondary data resources:
Build, mine and explicate audiences within SimmonsMRI, Global Web Index, etc.
Leverage data from realtime brand tracking with YouGov, ComScore, etc.

Leveraging 3rd party research
Digesting and analyzing third party research reports from Mintel, WARC, Pew, etc.
Staying on top of client-specific industry trends
Competencies and Expectations
Now that you know what the role entails, here’s what you need to be able to do to thrive in it.

A background market research or a consumer insights role in an advertising agency or marketing department

Data visualization: generation of charts and graphs within Excel/PowerPoint or Google Sheets. Tableau is a plus but not required.
A deep curiosity for understanding why consumers make decisions about brands and how culture influences them that process
A desire to understand the multiple ways to deliver on research objectives
An ability to present findings visually, verbally, and written. Telepathic communication is a plus but not required.
An ability to present market research findings to non-subject matter experts.
Experience in at least one of the following areas is required:
Social listening tools like Netbase, Meltwater, BrandWatch
Syndicated research services like SimmonsMRI or Global Web Index
Experience with research partners such as Kantar, MillwardBrown, IPSOS, MediaScience, LRW, etc
Experience
3-5 years of related experience within one of the following: Consumer or Brand Insights role at an advertising agency, market research firm, or marketing department

_Position Summary

The Data Analyst Apprenticeship is an entry-level position within Merck geared toward building upon the foundations of a career as a Data Analyst. As an Apprentice, you will complete the Open Classrooms Data Analyst Registered Apprenticeship training program while simultaneously working for Merck. You will earn a stipend during the training program. The program rhythm consists of one day of online technical training, working one-on-one with a mentor, and four days of on-the-job training per week. The 15-month competency-based training includes a 3-month intensive Bootcamp to build core skills and introduce tools and technology that will be used through the apprenticeship training program and 12 months of technical training.
Futureproof your career with OpenClassrooms

OpenClassrooms’ mission is to make education accessible to everyone. Through this apprenticeship opportunity with Merck, you can learn a new job while simultaneously receiving a unique 100% online training experience that combines 20% theory and 80% real-life projects, ensuring you are fully prepared for the job ahead. Joining OpenClassrooms means becoming part of a global community of over 12,000 active and motivated learners spread across 72 countries.

Analyze data to identify trends or relationships among variables.

Evaluate technical data to determine the effect on designs or plans.
Evaluate data quality.
Prepare data for analysis.
Present research results to others.
Prepare analytical reports.
Prepare graphics or other visual representations of information.
Design research studies to obtain scientific information.
Apply mathematical principles or statistical approaches to solve problems in scientific or applied fields.

Supervise information technology personnel.
Update knowledge about emerging industry or technology trends.
Implement security measures for computer or information systems.
Install computer software.
Write computer programming code.
Design software applications.

Able to work (100%remote or onsite/hybrid) within Merck’s Upper Gwynedd location.

Education- Client specific: Have a high school diploma, vocational certificate, or equivalent. With the highest qualification, an associate's degree or some college level.
Technical prerequisites to enroll in the Bootcamp:
OpenClassrooms Course Certificate: Improve your Data Literacy
APPLICATION PROCESS

Medical Insurance

Earn and Learn - earn a salary with benefits while training in a professional occupation.

Deliver ad-hoc reports and collaborate with other members of the Data Analytics team to streamline and/or automate processes to ensure data lineage, consistency, integrity, and transparency.

Within 1 month, you'll…

Lead query planning and create your first published query to GitHub.

Document your work in Jira and Notion.
